page.title: 08IBSTOCK BIRD "DOCTOR"
page.content: THE BACK GARDEN OF 85 STATION ROAD, IBSTOCK, IS HOME FOR AN INTERESTING COLLECTION OF{BIRDS OF PREY.} THEIR OWNER IS MR HARRY REED WHO BEGAN TO SPECIALISE IN{FALCONRY}WHEN PEOPLE STARTED TO TAKE WOUNDED BIRDS OF PREY TO HIM FOR TREATMENT. MR REED'S AVIARIES NOW SERVE AS A "HOSPITAL" FOR INJURED BIRDS SENT TO HIM BY THE ROYAL SOCIETY FOR THE PROTECTION OF BIRDS, LOCAL VETS AND THE ROYAL SOCIETY FOR THE PREVENTION OF CRUELTY TO ANIMALS. MANY OF THE BIRDS ARE ROAD ACCIDENT VICTIMS AND MR REED TRIES TO RESTORE THEM TO THE WILD AFTER TREATMENT. BIRDS OF PREY ARE CURRENTLY ON THE INCREASE SINCE THE OUTLAW OF DDT SPRAYS FOR FARM CROPS AND THE KESTREL, THE COUNTRY'S MOST COMMON BIRD OF PREY,IS WIDESPREAD IN THIS AREA.
